original_text: One day, Sennacherib was worshipping his god Nisrok, in Nisrok's temple. Two of Sennacherib's sons, Adrammelech and Sharezer, went in and they killed him with their swords. Then they ran away to the region of Ararat. Sennacherib's son, Esarhaddon, now ruled Assyria as king. 37: This happened about 20 years after verse 37 happened. One day, Sennacherib was worshipping his god Nisrok, in Nisrok's temple. Two of Sennacherib's sons, Adrammelech and Sharezer, went in and they killed him with their swords. Then they ran away to the region of Ararat. Sennacherib's son, Esarhaddon, now ruled Assyria as king. 37: This happened about 20 years after verse 37 happened. One day, Sennacherib was worshipping his god Nisrok, in Nisrok's temple. Two of Sennacherib's sons, Adrammelech and Sharezer, went in and they killed him with their swords. Then they ran away to the region of Ararat. Sennacherib's son, Esarhaddon, now ruled Assyria as king.
korean_text: 자기 신 니스록의 신전에서 경배할 때에 그의 아들 아드람멜렉과 사레셀이 그를 칼로 죽이고 아라랏 땅으로 도망하였으므로 그의 아들 에살핫돈이 이어 왕이 되니라

sentences.original_text: One day, Sennacherib was worshipping his god Nisrok
sentences.korean_translation: 어느 날, 산헤립은 그의 신 니스록을 숭배하고 있었다

sentences.original_text: Two of Sennacherib's sons, Adrammelech and Sharezer
went in and they killed him with their swords
Then they ran away to the region of Ararat
Sennacherib's son, Esarhaddon, now ruled Assyria as king
sentences.korean_translation: 산헤립의 아들 에萨尔하돈이 이제 앗시르의 왕으로 다스렸다

sentences.original_text: This happened about 20 years after verse 37 happened
sentences.korean_translation: 이 일은 37절이 일어난 후 약 20년 만에 일어났다
